Restoration Druid Mythic+ Guide

11.0.7 - The War Within

Last Updated:December 17, 2024|Changelog|FAQ

Welcome to the Restoration Druid Mythic+ guide for the World of Warcraft patch 11.0.2! This guide covers everything you need to know to understand your character! Are you starting out and leveling up from 70? Check out the leveling guide!

Hero Talents

Patch 11.0.7 - The War Within
Restoration Druid
  • Keeper of the Grove     focuses on AoE healing and Cooldown strength, while
    Wildstalker     focuses on Single Target healing and damage done in
    Cat Form    .
  • In a Mythic+ environment
    Wildstalker     outperforms
    Keeper of the Grove     in the majority of scenarios. Therefore this Guide focuses solely on the better option.
Keeper of the Grove
Wildstalker
  • Everytime you summon a
    Grove Guardian     you gain all of the following benefits:
    • Harmony of the Grove
      • 3% healing done increase per active
        Grove Guardian        .
    • Power of Nature
      • Rejuvenation        ,
        Efflorescence         and
        Lifebloom         healing is increased by 5% per active Grove Guardian.
    • Treants of the Moon
      • Your
        Grove Guardians         do damage passively.
    • Dream Surge
      • Your next direct heal creates 3 Dream Petals that each heal up to 3 Allies. These direct heals scale with your Mastery.
      • Further enhanced by
        Power of the Dream        .
  • Wild Growth    ,
    Regrowth     and
    Efflorescence     healing has a chance to spawn a
    Symbiotic Blooms     on the target, greatly increasing healing done to that target.
  • Symbiotic Blooms     is enhanced by the following nodes:
    • Vigorous Creepers
      • 20% increased healing done to targets with
        Symbiotic Blooms        .
    • Root Network
      • Increases your damage depending on how many
        Bloodseeker Vines         are active.
    • Bursting Growth
      • Small AoE healing is triggered if you cast
        Rejuvenation         on a target with
        Symbiotic Blooms         or
        Symbiotic Blooms         expires.

Talents

Patch 11.0.7 - The War Within
Restoration Druid
General

When to use this Spec

This is the default loadout going into any dungeon as it specializes in survivability. You have to adjust the class talent tree based on the utility needed for the affix and dungeon combo. To make your life easier, Dungeon specific talent loadouts are available in the Dungeons section.

Gameplay Altering Talents

Discover all talents that significantly alter your gameplay within the Spec and Class Talent trees. This section gives a concise overview of these talents and their applications but for a more detailed look check out the Rotation and Deep Dive sections below.

Spec Tree

  • Verdant Infusion
    • Enables you to extend your HoTs with
      Swiftmend      , which no longer consumes a HoT, greatly boosting your single-target healing.
  • Cenarius' Guidance
    • Cutting the cooldown of
      Convoke the Spirits       in half makes it a lot more versatile. With a 60 second cooldown, you can use it for damage and still have it ready for those key healing moments.
  • Forest's Flow
    • Greatly increases your ability to spot heal targets in need and increases the strength of your mastery.
  • Soul of the Forest
    • It empowers your core healing spells after every 
      Swiftmend       cast, making it a versatile and very powerful talent that greatly increases your healing capabilities.
  • Undergrowth
    • With this, you can have two separate
      Lifeblooms       on different targets, synergizing well with many other talents.
  • Photosynthesis
    • This talent makes selecting the correct target for your
      Lifeblooms       crucial. You can either greatly increase the healing for the entire group by placing it on yourself or make someone nearly immortal by placing
      Lifebloom       on them.
  • Rampant Growth
    • Applies
      Regrowth       to all active
      Lifebloom       targets, allowing you to apply up to three
      Regrowth       HoTs with a single cast.
  • Verdancy
    • Whenever one of your
      Lifeblooms       blooms, your
      Efflorescence       heals three targets within it. A good group can optimize this by having the tank step out of
      Efflorescence       when only non-tank members are in danger.
  • Renewing Surge
    • Allows you cast
      Swiftmend       more often and rewards you for good targeting!

Class Tree

  • Oakskin
    • Barkskin       now provides a 30% damage reduction, making it a respectable defensive cooldown.
  • Ursine Vigor
    • This increases your HP by an extra amount when shifting into
      Bear Form       for a short time. Timing this well makes you significantly tankier when taking damage while the buff is active.

Hero Talent Tree

  • Flower Walk
    • Adds a small heal and movement speed bonus to your
      Barkskin      .
  • Twin Sprouts
    • Very strong talent for damage output synergizes really well with
      Bursting Growth      .

Rotation

Patch 11.0.7 - The War Within
Restoration Druid

Tier Set

  • 2-Set: 
    Regrowth    ,
    Wild Growth    , and
    Swiftmend     healing increased by 10%.
  • 4-Set: Your healing is increased by 8% when consuming
    Soul of the Forest's     bonus and for 6 sec afterward.

Priority List

For Healing

  1. Keep
    Efflorescence     active on stack points, keep party movement in mind since this is your most expensive spell.
  2. Keep
    Lifebloom     on two targets that are preferably DPS players, refreshing it no earlier than 4.5 seconds left.
  3. Cast
    Swiftmend     followed by
    Wild Growth     if there is group dmg.
  4. Avoid capping
    Grove Guardians     stacks, if there is constant damage.
  5. Cast
    Regrowth     with any
    Omen of Clarity     procs you get.
  6. Cast
    Rejuvenation     on your
    Lifebloom     targets to get more
    Verdancy     procs.
  7. Cast
    Regrowth     on anyone without its HoT that is taking damage.
  8. Apply
    Rejuvenation     to anyone taking damage.
  9. Continuously cast
    Regrowth     on people taking damage.

For Damage

Single Target
AoE <5 targets
AoE 5+ targets
  1. Keep
    Rip     on your target.
  2. Cast
    Ferocious Bite     at 4 or more combo points.
  3. Keep
    Rake     on your target.
  4. Cast
    Shred     to avoid capping energy.
  5. Keep
    Moonfire     on your target.
  6. Keep
    Sunfire     on your target.
  7. Attack your target in
    Cat Form    .
  8. Cast
    Wrath     if you can not be in melee.
  1. Keep
    Rip     on as many targets as possible.
  2. Keep
    Rake     on as many targets as possible.
  3. Keep
    Thrash     active on all stacked mobs.
  4. Cast
    Swipe     to avoid capping energy.
  5. Keep
    Sunfire     on all stacked mobs.
  6. Keep
    Moonfire     on all targets.
  7. Attack your target in
    Cat Form    .
  8. Cast
    Starfire     if you can not be in meele.
  1. Maintain
    Sunfire     on all stacked mobs.
  2. Cast
    Starfire    .

Cooldowns

Cenarion Ward

  • When you apply
    Cenarion Ward     to someone who has your
    Lifebloom     and is in your
    Efflorescence    , they basically become invulnerable to damage for the entire duration of the
    Cenarion Ward    . The only thing to worry about is something that deals their entire HP pool worth of damage in one instance. Make sure to extend this via
    Verdant Infusion    .

Grove Guardians

  • Using multiple
    Grove Guardians     at the same time acts as a powerful healing cooldown. In party-sized content, each person typically has a high number of HoTs and
    Grove Guardians     scale extremely well with mastery. When there's constant damage, make sure you don't overcap them. However in boss fights with occasional damage, it's better to save them for the most dangerous times.
  • These are off the global cooldown and useable while shapeshifted without removing the form, so also a very great tool to heal low damage to continue damaging.

Deep Dive

Patch 11.0.7 - The War Within
Restoration Druid

Min maxing
Lifebloom

  • Picking the optimal target for
    Lifebloom     greatly increases your healing during critical moments. While you should always prioritize placing it on someone taking damage, it should ideally not be yourself. This is due to the synergy between
    Photosynthesis     and
    Verdancy    . The talents you picked also allow you to stack a massive number of HoTs on a Lifebloom target, greatly increasing the number of
    Verdancy     procs.
  • Another reason not to place
    Lifebloom     on yourself is that you do not benefit from the leech healing generated by
    Lifebloom's     massive healing. Most of the time, simply standing in your
    Efflorescence     and having some HoTs on yourself out heals any AoE damage you take when combined with leech. Mastering this separates a good Restoration Druid from a great one.

Min maxing
Efflorescence

  • The most obvious aspect of min-maxing
    Efflorescence     is its placement. If you position it well, it increases not only your DPS and HPS but also that of your party members. They need to be within your
    Efflorescence     to survive heavy group damage. The less movement you create, the better.
  • The next step of min-maxing this ability is more for coordinated groups as
    Verdancy     only heals 3 people, so if there are times when your tank does not need healing. Kindly ask him to never step into your
    Efflorescence     as he is stealing
    Verdancy     from your Group.

Optimizing
Heart of the Wild

  • To do the most single target damage during your
    Heart of the Wild     windows, you need to change how you spend Combo Points in
    Cat Form     as you automatically gain one Combo Point every 2 seconds. Meaning when you get to 3 combo points and do not overcap your energy you wait for the automatically generated combo point, and use a 4 combo point finisher to not risk over capping on Combo points as
    Primal Fury     might let you generate 2 combo points per generator.
  • In a 2-4 target situation, you should follow the same strategy. For 5 or more targets in AoE, nothing changes from the priority list.

Understanding Mechanics

Rotational min-maxing is just one aspect of mastering a specialization, but there are numerous other key mechanics that influence your performance. Use the following guides to improve them.

  • Pandemic
  • Spell Queue Window
  • Stat Diminishing Returns

Boss Tips

Avanoxx

  • General Tips
    • Always dispel
      Web Wrap       targets instantly.
    • Use your
      Cenarion Ward       exclusively for
      Gossamer Onslaught      .
  • Personal/External
    • As
      Alerting Shrill       does physical damage shifting into
      Bear Form       works like an actual defensive cooldown here. Therefore rotate between
      Barkskin       and
      Ironbark       to survive
      Gossamer Onslaught      .
    • Use
      Renewal       as the first line of emergency defensives, whenever you drop to low HP.

Anub'zekt

  • General Tips
    • Always stay close to the boss as it otherwise becomes harder to dodge
      Impale       the further you are away.
  • Output Cds
    • Rotate through your healing arsenal to heal through the damage done by
      Infestation      .
  • Personal/External
    • Fill holes in your healing cooldowns by using defensives and communicate that to your group.

Ki'katal the Harvester

  • General Tips
    • Keep an eye on your
      Incarnation: Tree of Life       duration when soaking
      Grasping Blood      , as when the effect runs out you be freed of that blood and potentially dragged into your death by
      Cosmic Singularity      .
    • Always dispel one
      Cultivated Poisons       as this dot does heavy damage.
  • Personal/External
    • Rotate through your defensive arsenal whenever you are affected by
      Cultivated Poisons      .

Trash Tips

  • Important abilities to interrupt in this dungeon are:
    • Trilling Attendant -
      Resonant Barrage
    • Ixin -
      Horrifying Shrill
    • Bloodstained Webmage -
      Revolting Volley
    • Blood Overseer -
      Venom Volley
  • Pay extra attention to these casts:
    • Sentry Stagshell -
      Alarm Shrill
      • A really long cast that needs to get disrupted.
    • Nerubian Hauler and Hulking Bloodguard -
      Massive Slam
      • A short stun that ramps in damage done per cast.
    • Nakt -
      Call of the Brood
      • Massive amount of damage to all players.

Boss Tips

Orator Krix'vizk

  • General Tips
    • Your Group needs to ensure that they are spread for
      Shadows of Doubt      , so you can instantly dispel one debuff.
  • Output Cds
    • The boss casts
      Vociferous Indoctrination       every 32 seconds making it very easy for you to always have either a
      Reforestation       proc or
      Convoke the Spirits       ready.
  • Personal/External
    • On higher keys, always use a defensive when you tank
      Shadows of Doubt       for its full duration.

Fangs of the Queen

  • General Tips
    • Stack in melee to instantly remove
      Freezing Blood      .
  • Output Cds
    • Always ensure to have a healing cd ready when
      Ice Sickles       happens.
  • Personal/External
    • Whenever
      Knife Throw       overlaps with
      Ice Sickles       use a personal.

The Coaglamation

  • General Tips
    • Viscous Darkness       knocks you. Make sure to not be knocked into an already existing pool!
  • Output Cds
    • Use
      Convoke the Spirits       every time
      Dark Pulse       happens, otherwise use your
      Reforestation       procs as often as possible as you need high constant healing on this encounter.
  • Personal/External
    • Ensure to have a personal defensive active when
      Dark Pulse       happens. This happens every 70 seconds so you will always have
      Barkskin       ready.

Izo, the Grand Splicer

  • General Tips
    • Stay stacked with your group to maximize
      Efflorescence      , as this fight has a high HPS requirement.
    • Stay stacked with your group, do not bait
      Shifting Anomalies       ahead.
  • Personal/External
    • Ensure to be in
      Bear Form       whenever
      Tremor Slam       or
      Umbral Weave       happens to survive the initial damage.

Trash Tips

  • Important abilities to interrupt in this dungeon are:
    • Sureki Silkbinder -
      Silk Binding
    • Herald of Ansurek -
      Twist Thoughts
    • Covert Webmancer -
      Mending Web
  • Pay extra attention to these casts:
    • Eye of the Queen -
      Void Rush
    • Royal Venomshell -
      Venomous Spray
    • Hulking Warshell -
      Tremor Slam
    • Elder Shadeweaver -
      Umbral Weave

Boss Tips

E.D.N.A.

  • General Tips
    • Dispel
      Seismic Reverberation       right after the boss beginns casting
      Seismic Smash       so your tank gets the damage reduction from
      Seismic Reverberation      .
  • Output Cds
    • Whenever you clear
      Volatile Spikes       with
      Refracting Beam       you need to have a Healing Cooldown.
  • Personal/External
    • Whenever you clear
      Volatile Spikes       with
      Refracting Beam       ensure to have a defensive cooldown active.

Skarmorak

  • General Tips
    • Whenever Void fragments spawn instantly soak one to gain
      Unstable Energy      . Extend the buff right before
      Fortified Shell      .
  • Output Cds
    • Rotate through your healing cooldown arsenal when the boss channels
      Void Discharge      .
  • Personal/External
    • Use your personal defensives when
      Void Discharge       happens.

Master Machinists Brokk and Dorlita

  • General Tips
    • Make sure to look around for safe vents to not get caught by surprise.
  • Output Cds
    • Whenever
      Exhaust Vents       occurs, you need to have either a
      Convoke the Spirits       or a
      Reforestation       ready to be able to heal through the massive damage.
  • Personal/External
    • Use
      Barkskin       when
      Exhaust Vents       overlaps with
      Metal Splinters      .

Void Speaker Eirich

  • General Tips
    • Use
      Stampeding Roar       to get rid of
      Void Corruption       as soon as possible.
  • Output Cds
    • This fight has a high constant HPS requirement so make sure you spread out your Cds to have a constant stream of high HPS.
  • Personal/External
    • Ensure to have a personal defensive active when you still have a
      Void Corruption       when the boss casts
      Entropic Reckoning      .

Trash Tips

  • Important abilities to interrupt in this dungeon are:
    • Ghastly Voidsoul -
      Howling Fear
    • Void Bound Howler -
      Piercing Wail
  • Pay extra attention to these casts:
    • Void Bound Despoiler -
      Void Storm
    • Forge Loader -
      Molten Mortar
    • Rock Smasher -
      Smash Rock
    • Cursedforge Honor Guard -
      Shield Stampede
    • Cursedforge Stoneshaper -
      Earth Burst Totem
    • Earth Burst Totem casts
      Earth Burst       which needs to be killed before it goes off.

Boss Tips

Speaker Shadowcrown

  • General Tips
    • Dispel
      Burning Shadows       as fast as possible.
  • Output Cds
    • Whenever you dispel
      Burning Shadows       your party gets a a dot with a healing absorb. Use a healing cooldown whenever
      Shadow Shroud       is active to heal the dot off as fast as possible.
  • Personal/External
    • There are no planned uses, use stuff freely when things go wrong.

Anub'ikkaj

  • General Tips
    • Make sure if you are targeted by
      Dark Orb       to not aim it into a wall, as if it does not travel for a long time you will wipe.
  • Output Cds
    • Shadowy Decay       happens every 41 seconds, so you have to alternate your healing cooldowns with your defensives and communicate that with your group. If you don't have either up this ability will kill you.
  • Personal/External
    • Rotate your personals to mitigate damage from
      Shadowy Decay      .

Rasha'nan

  • General Tips
    • Tell your group to not pick up
      Arathi Bomb       during
      Erosive Spray       cast to avoid unnecessary high damage overlap in Phase 1.
  • Output Cds
    • You need to heal through
      Erosive Spray       because people do need their defensive for when they are targeted with
      Spinneret's Strands      .
  • Personal/External
    • You cannot get targeted by
      Spinneret's Strands       as a healer so make sure to use your personals on
      Erosive Spray       instead.

Trash Tips

  • Important abilities to interrupt in this dungeon are:
    • Nightfall Shadowmage -
      Ensnaring Shadows
    • Nightfall Commander -
      Abyssal Howl
    • Nightfall Darkcaster -
      Tormenting Beam
  • Pay extra attention to these casts:
    • Ixkreten the Unbreakable -
      Terrifying Slam       and
      Abyssal Rot
    • Nightfall Dark Architect -
      Usher Reinforcements
    • Deathscreamer Iken'tak -
      Dark Orb       and
      Abyssal Rot
      • Watch out for players with
        Abyssal Rot         during
        Dark Orb         explosion.
    • Ascendant Vis'coxria -
      Shadowy Decay       and
      Abyssal Rot
      • Watch out for players with
        Abyssal Rot         during
        Shadowy Decay         cast.

Boss Tips

Ingra Maloch

  • General Tips
    • It is very easy to die on this boss if interrupts are not properly managed, ensure that during
      Embrace Darkness       no kick goes through as they will execute their target.
  • Output Cds
    • Save your healing CDs for when Ingra is protected by
      Embrace Darkness       as before there is no damage.
  • Personal/External
    • No planned uses, use stuff freely when things go wrong.

Mistcaller

  • General Tips
    • You should root the fox spawned by
      Freeze Tag       to help your party.
  • Output Cds
    • Save your healing cooldowns for
      Guessing Game       as that is the only time your Group takes damage.
  • Personal/External
    • Rotate through your defensive arsenal while
      Guessing Game       is active.

Tred'ova

  • General Tips
    • Focus on not moving a lot whenever
      Acid Expulsion       happens to not kill a team mate later down the line.
  • Output Cds
    • Save your healing cds for
      Consumption       as this is the only time your party takes heavy damage.
  • Personal/External
    • Use your defensives whenever you are focused as
      Marked Prey      .

Trash Tips

  • Important abilities to interrupt in this dungeon are:
    • Drust Harvester -
      Harvest Essence
    • Spinemaw Staghorn -
      Stimulate Resistance
  • Pay extra attention to these casts:
    • Drust Spiteclaw -
      Dying Breath
      • This debuffs enemies as well as players.
    • Tirnenn Villager -
      Overgrowth
    • Drust Boughbreaker -
      Furious Thrashing
      • Triggers at 50% HP of the Drust Boughbreaker.
    • Mistveil Defender -
      Mist Ward
    • Mistveil Stalker -
      Mistveil Bite
    • Mistveil Stinger -
      Anima Injection
      • Poison dispel.
    • Spinemaw Staghorn -
      Acid Nova

Boss Tips

Blightbone

  • General Tips
    • Use
      Incapacitating Roar       to disrupt the spawned adds.
  • Output Cds
    • Use everything to maximize damage as there is no AoE damage on this boss.
  • Personal/External
    • Ensure to be in
      Bear Form       and have a defensive cooldown active whenever targeted by
      Heaving Retch      .

Amarth, The Harvester

  • Output Cds
    • Save your healing cooldowns for after
      Final Harvest       is completed as that is the only time AoE damage happens.
  • Personal/External
    • Ensure to have a defensive active whenever your group runs out of interrupts and you are targeted by
      Necrotic Bolt      .

Surgeon Stitchflesh

  • General Tips
    • The most important part about this encounter is to hit the hook at the correct time. Use your
      Stampeding Roar       to help your party with that.
  • Output Cds
    • Save your healing cooldowns for when multiple abominations are active as
      Festering Rot       does heavy group damage.
  • Personal/External
    • Ensure to have a defensive active whenever you are targeted with
      Stitchneedle      .

Nalthor the Rimebinder

  • Output Cds
    • Save your healing cooldowns for
      Icebound Aegis       as this is the only time AoE damage happens.
  • Personal/External
    • Rotate through your defensive arsenal whenever
      Icebound Aegis       is active on the boss.

Trash Tips

  • Important abilities to interrupt in this dungeon are:
    • Corpse Harvester -
      Drain Fluids
    • Stitched Vanguard -
      Meat Shield
    • Skeletal Marauder -
      Rasping Scream
    • Corpse Collector -
      Goresplatter
  • Pay extra attention to these casts:
    • Zolramus Necromancer -
      Grim Fate
    • Skeletal Marauder -
      Gruesome Cleave
      • Fast frontal cast.
    • Flesh Crafter -
      Throw Cleaver
      • This spell also does damage to enemies and should be aimed at any enemy to deal extra damage.
        • Help with this by positioning the mobs in front of the Flesh Crafter.
    • Loyal Creation -
      Spine Crush
      • A big circle cast that can't be disrupted as it recasts until the cast is finished once.

Boss Tips

Chopper Redhook

  • General Tips
    • Use
      Stampeding Roar       to help people run away from
      On the Hook      .
  • Output Cds
    • Save your healing cooldowns for when
      Gore Crash       happens to ensure nobody gets executed by a
      Molten Slug      .
  • Personal/External
    • Ensure to have a defensive active when targeted by
      Molten Slug       and
      Gore Crash       is about to happen.

Dread Captain Lockwood

  • Output Cds
    • Always have hots active whenever
      Fiery Ricochet       is about to happen.
  • Personal/External
    • Ensure to have a defensive active when you are targeted by
      Fiery Ricochet      .

Hadal Darkfathom

  • General Tips
    • Use
      Stampeding Roar       to help people dodge
      Tidal Surge      .
  • Output Cds
    • Break Water       is the only damage event on this boss. Ensure people are always topped before this.
  • Personal/External
    • Rotate through your defensive arsenal whenever
      Break Water       happens.

Viq'Goth

  • General Tips
    • Always have your group be spread to be able to instantly dispel a
      Putrid Waters      .
  • Output Cds
    • Spot heal
      Putrid Waters       whenever
      Slam       happens.
  • Personal/External
    • Whenever you tank
      Putrid Waters       for its duration ensure to have a defensive active.
    • Use
      Ironbark       on
      Putrid Waters       targets without defensives.

Trash Tips

    • Bilge Rat Pillager -

  • Pay extra attention to these casts:
    • Scrimshaw Enforcer -
      Slobber Knocker
      • Casted frontal cone that is hard to see.
    • Irontide Raider -
      Iron Hook       into

    • Blacktar Bomber -
      Fire Bomb

      Azerite Charge
    • Irontide Powdershot -

    • Ashvane Spotter -

Boss Tips

General Umbriss

  • General Tips
    • Use
      Stampeding Roar       to dodge
      Shadow Breath      .
  • Personal/External
    • Ensure to always be in
      Bear Form       when
      Commanding Roar       happens.

Forgemaster Throngus

  • General Tips
    • Bait
      Fiery Cleave       to the nearest wall to save boss room space.
  • Output Cds
    • Save your healing cooldowns for whenever Throngus has his sword out, as that is the phase when heavy AoE damage happens.
  • Personal/External
    • Rotate through your defensive arsenal whenever affected by
      Molten Spark      .

Drahga Shadowburner

  • General Tips
    • Make sure to dispel
      Curse of Entropy       as the highest priority.
  • Output Cds
    • Rotate through your healing cooldown arsenal for every
      Twilight Buffet      .
  • Personal/External
    • Ensure to have a defensive active when
      Twilight Buffet       happens.

Erudax, the Duke of Below

  • General Tips
    • Use
      Stampeding Roar       whenever
      Shadow Gale       happens.
  • Output Cds
    • You have to heal through
      Void Surge       as people need their defensives to survive the overlap of
      Abyssal Corruption       and
      Shadow Wound      .

Trash Tips

  • Important abilities to interrupt in this dungeon are:
    • Twilight Earthcaller -
      Mass Tremor
    • Twilight Beguiler -
      Sear Mind
  • Pay extra attention to these casts:
    • Twilight Destroyer -
      Umbral Wind
      • You can LoS this cast.
    • Twilight Overseer -
      Reckless Tactic
      • Purge it if needed.
    • Molten Giant -
      Molten Wake
    • Twilight Lavabender -
      Ascension       and
      Dark Eruption
      • Ascension         triggers at 50% HP and starts pulsing
        Scorching Heat         group damage.
    • Twilight Warlock -
      Enveloping Shadowflame
    • Twilight Enforcer -
      Ramping Rage
    • Mutated Hatchling -
      Shadow Wound
    • Faceless Corruptor -
      Corrupt       and
      Mind Piercer

Affixes

Affixes

The Affix system got revamped going into The War Within Season 1 retiring most Affixes as well as introducing new kiss-curse ones while also changing on which key level these appear.

  • +2 Affixes -- Rotates on a weekly basis
    • Xal'atath's Bargain: Ascendant
    • Xal'atath's Bargain: Voidbound
    • Xal'atath's Bargain: Oblivion
    • Xal'atath's Bargain: Devour
  • +4 Affixes -- Alternates between each other on a weekly basis
    • Tyrannical
    • Fortified
  • +7 Affix
    • Challenger's Peril
  • +10 Affixes -- Alternates between each other on a weekly basis, is always the opposite of the +4 Affix
    • Tyrannical
    • Fortified
  • +12 Affix
    • Xal'atath's Guile       -- Replaces the +2 Affix

Following you get some useful tips for handling different Mythic+ Affixes as a Restoration Druid.

  • Xal'atath's Bargain: Ascendant
    • Use
      Incapacitating Roar       to interrupt as many orbs as possible.
  • Xal'atath's Bargain: Voidbound
    • There is nothing special you can do to help with this affix.
  • Xal'atath's Bargain: Oblivion
    • Keep an eye behind you and collect any orbs that fly into melee range. Make sure to intercept them before they hit any enemies.
  • Xal'atath's Bargain: Devour
    • Make sure to instantly dispel a healing absorb debuff!

Stat Priority

Patch 11.0.7 - The War Within
Restoration Druid

Understand your secondary stat priority and the tertiary stats needed for optimal performance during Mythic+ dungeons as a Restoration Druid. For more detailed information, visit the Stats and Attributes guide.

The conclusion here is that you want to equip the highest item level generally.

All secondary stats are affected by diminishing returns. Click here to learn more!

Tertiary

  • Avoidance - Reduces damage taken from AoE effects.
  • Leech - Returns a portion of your damage and healing done as healing to you. (Excludes self healing)
  • Speed - increases movement speed. (Does stack with other movement speed abilities)

The only time you should think about picking a lower item level is if it has Leech or Avoidance. Speed is nice to have, but you should generally ignore that stat.

Here is a showcase of how powerful Leech is for a Healer:

Patch 11.0.7 - The War Within
Restoration Druid
Best in Slot
Farmable Alternatives

Due to the way stat weights work for Restoration Druids, there isn't a strict best-in-slot list. Although it is theoretically possible to obtain items with all the correct Tertiaries, doing so requires extraordinary luck or several human lifespans because of the weekly reset system in World of Warcraft.

Authors Note:

This list shows the best items for healing in Raids from all sources. Keep in mind that getting different tier pieces with Leech / Avoidance changes which off-piece is best for you. Likewise, any other non-trinket item with Leech / Avoidance replaces the one suggested here.

Below you are presented with a good list of farmable alternatives that are obtainable outside of WoWs weekly lockout system. While replaced in time as you progress, these offer immediate character power.

Trinkets

Below you can find active and passive alternatives to our recommended trinkets. Do note that some trinkets are better than others depending on the dungeon.

Active Trinket alternatives

  • Spymaster's Web
    • A strong On-Use Trinket that rewards precise planning. It takes 4 minutes to reach max stacks, so make sure to tie it to the important damage events instead of just using it on cooldown!

Passive Trinket alternatives

  • Empowering Crystal of Anub'ikkaj
    • A very strong stat stick, granting you a huge random secondary stat proc.
  • Ovi'nax's Mercurial Egg
    • Very interesting Trinket, that gives you a mix of main stat and your highest secondary. Use it when moving to the next pull to keep a good distribution.
  • Ara-Kara Sacbrood
    • Another very good stat stick that also deals a very minor amount of damage.

Embellishments

  • Darkmoon Sigil: Ascension
    • Very strong stat stick that gives you a high amount of a random secondary stat that changes every 8 seconds.
  • Writhing Armor Banding
    • Doubles the effect of your
      Darkmoon Sigil: Ascension      .

Remaining Sparks

  • Crafted items are 636 item level and regular items are 639 on max item level, therefore, it's not beneficial to equip crafted items outside of your 2x embellishments unless you don't have access to other high item level gear on that slot.

Races

Patch 11.0.7 - The War Within
Restoration Druid

For min-maxing a Restoration Druid in Mythic+ Dungeons, different racial traits can provide a tremendous benefit to your characters. If this is not your top goal, picking a race that fits your style works just as well.

  • Shadowmeld     -- Night Elf
    • Turns you invisible, any action, movement, or suffering any damage breaks this effect.
    • Use-cases:
      • Run past basically any mob and then cast
        Shadowmeld         to make them reset. Even works on mobs that have stealth detection if you get enough distance before you
        Shadowmeld        .

Recommendation:

It is highly recommended to play a

Night Elf this season! The higher the keys you run, the more essential
Shadowmeld becomes in certain dungeons, such as Neltharus and others.

Addons

Patch 11.0.7 - The War Within
Restoration Druid

Below, you see a screenshot of the author's User Interface for their Restoration Druid, outlining which addons are used and how they are utilized in Mythic+ Dungeons to make your life easier.

Addons

  • OmniCD -- Party CD Tracker
    • Addon to track your party members' Cooldowns, mandatory for M+
  • ElvUI / BetterBlizzFrames -- Party/Raidframe Addon
    • Addon to replace your Unitframes and other UI Elements with a more clean look. Takes quite some time to configure but there are plenty of pre-done profiles that you can easily import and check out.
    • Alternatively, you can also use BetterBlizzFrames if you want to not spend hours configuring this.
  • WeakAuras -- Jack of all trades
    • WeakAura allows players to create and customize graphical displays of game information. These displays, known as "auras" can show various aspects such as buffs, debuffs, cooldowns, health, and other important events.
  • Plater -- Nameplate Addon
    • Plater is a nameplate addon with an extraordinary amount of settings, out of the box debuff tracking, threat coloring, and support for scripting similar to WeakAuras + the WeakAuras-Companion for Mod/Script/Profile updates.
  • BigWigs -- BossMods Addon
    • BigWigs is a boss encounter add-on. It consists of many individual encounter scripts, or boss modules; mini add-ons that are designed to trigger alert messages, timer bars, sounds, and so forth, for one specific Raid encounter.
  • Details -- Damage Meter
    • Shows you Damage/Healing throughout the dungeon

WeakAuras

These WeakAuras are recommended for optimal performance in mythic+ as a Restoration Druid.

Lifebloom & Efflorescence curser

Add small duration trackers to your cursor for

Lifebloom and efflorescence to ensure they are constantly being used.

Changes this Patch

Patch 11.0.7 - The War Within
Restoration Druid

Patch 11.0.1

Druid

  • All talent trees have had many talents move locations or have had their pathing updated.
  • New Talent: Oakskin Survival Instincts and Barkskin reduce damage taken by an additional 10%.
  • New Talent: Fluid Form Shred and Rake can be used in any form and shifts you into Cat Form. Mangle can be used in any form and shifts you into Bear Form. Wrath and Starfire shifts you into Moonkin Form, if known.
  • New Talent: Ursoc's Spirit Stamina in Bear Form is increased by 10%.
  • New Talent: Instincts of the Claw Shred, Swipe, Rake, Mangle, and Thrash damage increased by 5/10%.
  • New Talent: Lore of the Grove Moonfire and Sunfire damage increased by 5/10%. Rejuvenation and Wild Growth healing increased by 3/5%.
  • New Talent: Starlight Conduit Wrath, Starsurge, and Starfire damage increased by 5%. For non-Balance, Starsurge's cooldown is reduced by 4 seconds and its mana cost is reduced by 50%.
  • Improved Swipe has been removed from the talent tree and its benefit added to Swipe by default.
  • Moonkin Form has been removed from the talent tree and is now learned at level 10 for Balance Druids.
  • Swiftmend has been removed from the talent tree and is now learned at level 11 for Restoration Druids.
  • Heart of the Wild now reduces the global cooldown of affected Balance cast-time spells.
  • Cat Form now increases the range of auto-attacks and melee abilities by 3 yards.
  • Feline Swiftness now increases movement speed by 15%. Now a 1-point talent.
  • Thick Hide now reduces damage taken by 4%. Now a 1-point talent.
  • Natural Recovery now increases healing received by 4% and no longer increases healing done. Now a 1-point talent.
  • Astral Influence now increases the range of all your spells by 5 yards and no longer increases auto attack or melee ability range. Now a 1-point talent.
  • Primal Fury now also increases critical strike damage of Mangle by 20%.
  • Ursine Vigor now increases Stamina and armor in Bear Form by 15% for 4 seconds. Now a 1-point talent.
  • Guardian Druid improved Bear Form Stamina bonus decreased to 10% (was 20%).
  • Lycara's Teachings is now a 2-point talent that grants 3/6% of various secondary stats.
  • Forestwalk now increases your movement speed and healing received by 8% for 6 seconds. Now a 1-point talent.
  • Well-Honed Instincts' effect now occurs once every 120 seconds. Now a 1-point talent.
  • Mass Entanglement now roots targets for 10 seconds (was 30 seconds).
  • Tireless Pursuit has been removed.

Restoration

  • New Talent: Dream of Cenarius While Heart of the Wild is active, Wrath and Shred transfer 150% of their damage and Starfire and Swipe transfer 100% of their damage into healing onto a nearby ally.
  • New Talent: Call of the Elder Druid When you shift into a combat shapeshift form or cast Starsurge, you gain Heart of the Wild for 10 seconds, once every 60 seconds.
  • New Talent: Thriving Vegetation Rejuvenation instantly heals for 15/30% of its periodic healing and Regrowth's duration is increased by 3/6 seconds.
  • New Talent: Prosperity Swiftmend now has 2 charges.
  • Tranquility initial healing increased by 400%.
  • Tranquility's initial heal now decreases its healing beyond 5 targets.
  • Tranquility's heal over time effect is no longer increased while out of a raid environment.
  • Rejuvenation healing increased by 60%.
  • Grove Guardian's healing reduced by 15%.
  • Wild Synthesis Wild Growth healing reduced by 15%.
  • Verdant Infusion now extends the duration of heal over time effects by 8 seconds (was 12 seconds).
  • Nurturing Dormancy is now capped at 4 second extension (was 6 seconds).
  • Abundance now increases the Critical Strike chance of Regrowth by 8% and decreases its mana cost by 8% per stack (was 5%).
  • Soul of the Forest and Heart of the Wild added to Personal Resource Display.
  • The following talents have been removed:
    • Adaptive Swarm
    • Unbridled Swarm
    • Luxuriant Soil

Patch 11.0.2

Druid

  • Regrowth initial heal increased by 27% and its healing over time decreased by 3%.
  • Swiftmend healing increased by 38%.
  • Ironfur increases Armor by 112% of Agility (was 120%).

Restoration

  • Lifebloom heal over time increased by 5% and bloom healing increased by 30%.
  • Tranquility healing increased by 15%.
  • Rejuvenation healing increased by 15%.
  • Rejuvenation now costs 2.1% base mana (was 2.2%).
  • Wild Growth healing increased by 15%.
  • Cenarion Ward healing increased by 20%.
  • Embrace of the Dream healing increased by 50%.
  • Nourish healing increased by 100%.
  • Grove Guardians Nourish and Wild Growth healing decreased by 10%.
  • Convoke the Spirits now casts an additional 4 spells over its duration for Restoration Druids.
  • Flourish's duration is now 8 seconds (was 6 seconds).
  • Regenesis now increases the healing of Rejuvenation by up to 15/30% (was 10/20%).
  • Power of the Archdruid now has a 60% chance to activate (was 40%).
  • Tree of Life now increases healing done by 10% (was 15%) and increases the healing of Rejuvenation by 40% (was 50%).
  • Rip damage decreased by 15%. Does not affect PvP combat.
  • Rake damage decreased by 15%.
  • Shred damage decreased by 15%.
  • Ferocious Bite damage decreased by 15%. Does not affect PvP combat.
  • Sunfire damage decreased by 15%.
  • Fixed an issue that caused Mastery: Harmony to gain an extra stack on all targets.

Patch 11.0.5

Druid

  • Mark of the Wild now costs 1% base mana (was 4%).
  • Adaptive Swarm's icon has been updated.
  • Convoke the Spirits' icon has been updated.).

Restoration

  • New Talent: Reactive Resin When your Restoration heal over time effects are removed by enemies, they are replaced with Reactive Resin, healing an ally over 6 seconds. Multiple stacks may overlap. Passive ability.
  • New Talent: Twinleaf Nature's Swiftness now has 2 charges.
  • New Talent: Wildwood Roots Abundance now also reduces the cast time of Regrowth by 5% per stack. Cenarion Ward's cooldown is reduced by 10 seconds and its duration is increased by 2 seconds.
  • New Talent: Renewing Surge The cooldown of Swiftmend is reduced by up to 40%, based on the current health of the target. Cooldown is reduced more when cast on a lower health target.
  • New Talent: Forest's Flow Consuming Clearcasting now causes your Regrowth to also cast Nourish onto a nearby injured ally at 60% effectiveness, preferring those with your heal over time effects.
  • Dream of Cenarius has been redesigned Wrath and Shred transfer 50% of their damage and Starfire and Swipe transfer 33% of their damage into healing onto a nearby ally. This effect is increased by 200% while Heart of the Wild is active.
  • Omen of Clarity is now a passive ability learned at level 12 (was a talent).
  • Harmonious Blooming is now a 1-point talent.
  • Flourish's visual effect has been improved.
  • Wildstalker
    • Flourish now affects Symbiotic Blooms.
  • Restoration
    • Call of the Elder Druids duration increased to 15 seconds (was 10 seconds).
    • Dream of Cenarius now causes Wrath and Shred to transfer 100% (was 50%) of their damage done into healing and Starfire and Swipe to transfer 50% of their damage done into healing (was 33%).
    • Developers notes: Were looking to increase the playability of Dream of Cenarius, as the window for Heart of the Wild is a bit too short to be meaningful and the upside of this talent has not yet been worth it.

FAQ

Patch 11.0.7 - The War Within
Restoration Druid

Q: Why do I keep dying?

A: Start using

Ironbark as a personal defensive cooldown.

Q: Why do I keep running out of mana?

A: Keep

Lifebloom uptime at 100%, and don't waste a single
Omen of Clarity proc.
